section.name: What is Hippo ECM?
section.p: Hippo ECM bundles a set of applications for managing information in large-scale organizational environments.

Managing all information in an organization is a daunting task. Knowledge is stored in numerous files, emails, webpages, forms, Excel sheets, and so on, and is handled differently for every organization. To work with all this information, every organization employs a diverse set of applications that adds logic and behaviour. How to integrate those applications, manage the underlaying information and present the end user with a simple, unified environment for all their information management?
Hippo ECM structures information, offers integration possibilities on both content and presentation level, in a simple and for users understandable way.

section.name: History of Hippo ECM
section.p: The first stable distribution of Hippo CMS version 6 was released in June 2004. This new release introduced a fresh architecture where Hippo CMS, a frontend application and the content repository were seperated in different server applications. This seperation of concerns on setup level has been one of the main drivers of the success of Hippo CMS v6.0. It allowed for complex integrations with external systems while keeping a strong focus on a standardized user interface for the end-user. The focus on standardized protocols and XML technologies opened up the possibilities needed for enterprise wide CMS usage. Scalability and load balancing functionalities have added to the stability of the platform and allowed it to be used in the largest, content rich environments. A familiar user interface driven by AJAX technologies to update only those parts of the application that needed to do so brought wide user acceptance. On the developer's side, the concept of deployments and custom builds allowed external developers to setup and use the Hippo CMS platform for a diverse set of applications.

All of these developments combined have led to the current stable v6.04 release, rich in functionalities and possibilities. They have also inspired developers and customers to raise ideas and whishes that go far beyond what's possible today. But the architectural concept has proven itself, and those new ideas only intensify the feeling that we're on the right track. We are facing new horizons and need to take that leap to jump to the next level of extendibility, user experience and scalability. Together with the HippoCMS.org community, Hippo will be driving the development of the future version of the Hippo Content Platform, consisting of Hippo CMS v7, Hippo Repository v2 and Hippo Portal v1.
